statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Mary's 82, Sonoma St. 57
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Saint Mary's never trailed as returning all-West Coast Conference player Diamon Simpson and Australian freshman Patrick Mills combined for 35 points in an 82-57 victory over Division II Sonoma State in the Saint Mary's Tip-Off Classic on Friday. Mills drove for a layup for the first basket of the game. Simpson scored on an inside move, then hit a 3-pointer with Mills getting the assist after leading a fast break and passing back to Simpson as Saint Mary's jumped to a 7-1 lead. Simpson had 18 points, 11 rebounds and five blocks for Saint Mary's (1-0). Mills had 17 points, five assists and four steals to lead the Gaels into Saturday's tournament finals against Drake, an 81-63 winner over UC San Diego in the first game. Saint Mary's took advantage of its height and quickness but let Sonoma State hang fairly close in the first half by committing 17 fouls and turning the ball over 14 times, the same number as the Seawolves. Sonoma State hit 11-of-21 free throws in the first half but went 0-for-3 in the second half from the line. Saint Mary's outrebounded Sonoma State 42-36 but wound up with 21 turnovers, three more than the Seawolves. Tron Smith and Omar Samhan each had 12 for the Gaels, who hit 51.8 percent from the floor (29-for-56). Saint Mary's had nine blocks. Andrew Kochevar, who hit three straight 3-pointers late in the game, had 21 for Sonoma State with Blake Saunders scoring 16. Saunders also had 11 rebounds. The game was Saint Mary's regular-season opener but was considered an exhibition for Sonoma State, which lost an earlier exhibition 71-66 to Saint Mary's West Coast Conference rival San Francisco.
